Tony's AI is about all that is worth using with the Bioware modules.  One word of advice about playing the OC... though all the prestige classes (yes, including shifter), new feats and spells were folded into the OC as of v1.69, the campaign itself was never rebalanced.  The result is that even playing it on the hardest diff setting, there will scarcely be any significant challenge for most builds.  If you want to fool with hench inventory, fine... but unless you improve the monster AI, it will become ridiculously easy with a well-equipped comrade-in-arms and not at all representative of a typical romp through NWN-land.

After you finish the Bioware content, download the CEP pak.  I still use v2.3 but the claim is that the newest version is dependable.  You'll need at least the CEP pak for much CC and many PWs.  There will also be additional haks for some venues, but I'd wait until I encountered them before trying to anticipate every need.  I wouldn't touch the PRC resources with a 10-foot pike but that is just from my own bad experience with it.

TBH, I also had some problems getting .xlsx to open with just my MSOffice 2002 version of Excel.  I remember needing to install some sort of compatibility fix from the Microsoft site but can't recall the procedure.  It was somewhat of a nightmare to get them to open and now I save and use all Excel as the 2002 format.  If you would like a copy of CBC2002, email me for a delivery addy.  I see Kamiryn just offers the MSOffice 2007 version on the Vault now so you have few choices.  Yes, the viewer is pretty much worthless for building toons since we usually post all the stats right on these boards.
